TypeDefinition.Description: artesian point (x, y position)

Field.name: x
Field.Description: x coordinate

Field.name: y
Field.Description: y coordinate

TypeDefinition.Description: Cylindrical coordinate (r, theta, z)

Field.name: r
Field.Description: radius coordinate value

Field.name: theta
Field.Description: theta coordinate value

Field.name: z
Field.Description: z coordinate value

TypeDefinition.Description: Defines a primitive data type with the values of true and false
Defines a primitive data type representing a signed two byte integer value
Defines a primitive data type representing a signed four byte integer value with no units of measure
Defines a primitive data type representing a signed eight byte integer value
Defines a primitive data type representing a four byte floating point value
Defines a primitive data type representing a date and time
80 characters maximum; modified primitive string data type with a limited number of characters
128 characters maximum; modified primitive string data type with a limited number of characters
255 characters maximum; modified primitive string data type with a limited number of characters
Array of events that will cause the job to pause
Defines a reference to an EDA event instance

Field.name: EventID
Field.Description: EDA event identifier

Field.name: Locator
Field.Description: Locator of the source

TypeDefinition.Description: List of EDA event references
Value of the recipe variable
Recipe variable used to tune a process recipe

Field.name: RecipeVarName
Field.Description: The name of the recipe variable

TypeDefinition.Description: List of variables supporting a recipe method
List of slots involved
Carrier and slots used in an action

Field.name: CarrierID
Field.Description: Identifier of the carrier

Field.name: Slots
Field.Description: List of slots within the carrier

TypeDefinition.Description: Material Location state enumeration

EnumeratedString.Description: Material location does not hold or have any material
Material location holds material

TypeDefinition.Description: Equipment Control State. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in GEM but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: System maintains the OffLine state and requires operator instructions to attempt to go OnLine (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Equipment attempting to change state to OnLine (corresponds to SECS value 2)
Equipment is intent on being Online, however, the Host has not agreed (corresponds to SECS value 3)
Operation of the equipment is implemented by direct action of an operator (corresponds to SECS value 4)
Operation of the equipment is implemented by host automation (corresponds to SECS value 5)

TypeDefinition.Description: Defines a reference to an EDA Parameter

Field.name: Source
Field.Description: Locator of the EquipmentNode or SEMIObject where the Parameter is defined

Field.name: Name
Field.Description: Name attribute of the Parameter

TypeDefinition.Description: Action taken on the process program. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in GEM but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Process program created (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Process proram edited or modified (corresponds to SECS value 2)
Process program deleted (corresponds to SECS value 3)

TypeDefinition.Description: Indicates the type of process programs and recipes that are supported

EnumeratedInteger.Description: Unformatted process programs
Formatted process programs
Both unformatted and formatted process programs
Execution Recipes
Large unformatted process programs
Large formatted process programs
Both large unformatted and large formatted process programs
Large execution recipes
Both execution recipes and large execution recipes
Both unformatted and large unformatted process programs
Both formatted and large formatted process programs
Both unformatted and large formatted process programs
Both formatted and large unformatted process programs
Unformatted, large unformated, and large formatted process programs
Formatted, large unformatted, and large formatted process programs
Formatted, unformatted, large unformatted, and large formatted process programs

TypeDefinition.Description: The processing state of the equipment. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in GEM but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: The equipment is awaiting instructions
All external conditions necessary for process execution are satisfied
Equipment is ready for process execution and is awaiting a Start command from the operator or host
Equipment is executing a process program automatically and can continue to do so without external intervention
Processing is suspended and the equipment is awaiting a command

TypeDefinition.Description: Format for reporting date and time information

EnumeratedString.Description: Date and Time reported in the 12 character form of YYMMDDhhmmss
Date and Time reported in the 16 character form of YYYMMDDhhmmsscc
Date and Time reported in the form of YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD

TypeDefinition.Description: A unique sub-state of the job according to the ProcessJob state model. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E40.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: The ProcessJob has been accepted by the processing resource through a PR Job Create/Achnowledge transaction and is awaiting execution (corresponds to SECS value 0)
The processing resource performs pre-conditioning, waits material arrival, and prepares for material processing (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Setup is complete and a PR Job Start Process has not yet been received by the processing resource (corresponds to SECS value 2)
The processing resource is doing the actual material processing using the equipment recipe(s) specified by the PR Job (corresponds to SECS value 3)
The processing resource has completed processing all material specified by the PR Job (corresponds to SECS value 4)
The processing resource continues to the first safe, continuable place and then ceases activity (corresponds to SECS value 6)
All processing resource activity has ceased (corresponds to SECS value 7)
The processing resource is performing a stop procedure to terminate processing in an orderly manner (corresponds to SECS value 8)
The process resource is performing an abort or an optional recovery procedure (corresponds to SECS value 9)
Final state for those jobs that have been in the Stopping State (corresponds to SECS value 10)
Final state for those jobs that have been in the Aborting State (corresponds to SECS value 11)

TypeDefinition.Description: List of identifiers of the carriers and slots being processed
List of identifiers of the substrates being processed; each string holds a Substrate ID
List of identifiers of the material being processed
Identifies the type of material being processed. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E40.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Material selected by Carrier ID and slots (corresponds to SECS value 13)
Material selected by Substrate ID (corresponds to SECS value 14)

TypeDefinition.Description: Indication of recipe specification type, whether using is applied and which method is used. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E40.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Only values defined within the recipe will be used (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Recipe tuning variables will be tuned by specified recipe variable list (corresponds to SECS value 2)

TypeDefinition.Description: Carrier ID verification status. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E87.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: CarrierID has not been read by the equipment (corresponds to SECS value 0)
CarrierID has been read by the equipment successfully or unsuccessfully and has not yet been verified by the host (corresponds to SECS value 1)

CarrierID has been accepted either by successful verification by the equipment or the host, or by bypassing ID read because a carrier ID reader is not available and the BypassReadID variable is set to true (corresponds to SECS value 2)
CarrierID has failed verification by the host (corresponds to SECS value 3)

TypeDefinition.Description: Accessing state of the carrier by the equipment. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E87.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Access by the equipment has not been started (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Access by the equipment to the carrier has been started but has not been finished (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Access by the equipment to the carrier has been finished (corresponds to SECS value 2)
Access by the equipment to the carrier has been stopped abnormally (corresponds to SECS value 3)

TypeDefinition.Description: Lot and substrate identifier for a slot

Field.name: LotID
Field.Description: Lot the substrate is associated with (null if unknown or no substrate present)

Field.name: SubstrateID
Field.Description: Identifier of the substrate in the slot (null if no substrate present)

TypeDefinition.Description: Order list of lot and substrate identifiers corresponding to slot 1,2,3,...n
Status of a carrier slot. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E87.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: The state of the slot is not known (corresponds to SECS value 0)
The slot is empty (corresponds to SECS value 1)
The slot is not empty (may be correctly or incorrectly occupied) (corresponds to SECS value 2)
The slot has a properly positioned substrate (corresponds to SECS value 3)
The slot has more than one substrate present (corresponds to SECS value 4)
The slot is cross slotted with another slot in the carrier (corresponds to SECS value 5)

TypeDefinition.Description: Ordered list of slot status corresponding to slot 1,2,3,...n
State of the slot map verification. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E87.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Carrier has been loaded but the slot map has not been read by the equipment (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Equipment is waiting for input from the host (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Slot map has been verified (corresponds to SECS value 2)
Slot map has been read by the equipment and has failed verification by the host (corresponds to SECS value 3)

TypeDefinition.Description: Carrier identifier and location

Field.name: LocationID
Field.Description: Identifier of the location the carrier is at

Field.name: CarrierID
Field.Description: Identifier of the carrier

TypeDefinition.Description: A list of all carriers at/in the equipment
Reason for transition 14, SlotMapNotRead to WaitingForHost. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E87.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Equipment needs host to verify carrier ID (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Equipment failed to verify the carrier ID (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Failed to read carrier ID (corresponds to SECS value 2)
Improper Substrate Position (corresponds to SECS value 3)

TypeDefinition.Description: Transfer state of a load port. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E87.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Transfer to/from this load port is disabled (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Load port related activity being performed, transfer is not available to/from this load port at this time (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Load port is available to be loaded with an external carrier, or with a carrier that is currently located inside the equipment (corresponds to SECS value 2)
Load port is available for unloading of a carrier from the Load Port to material handling equipment (corresponds to SECS value 3)

TypeDefinition.Description: PortAssociationState combined with the PortAssociationState for a load port

Field.name: PortAssociationState
Field.Description: The association state of the load port

Field.name: PortTransferState
Field.Description: Transfer state of the load port

TypeDefinition.Description: List of PortStateInfo for all load ports
Load Port Transfer State for all load ports
Reservation state for a load port. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E87.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: No reservation exists for the load port (corresponds to SECS value 0)
A reservation for future activity at the load port exists (corresponds to SECS value 1)

TypeDefinition.Description: Reservation state of all load ports
Association state of a Load Port. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E87.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: No carrier association present for the Load Port (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Carrier has been associated with the Load Port (corresponds to SECS value 1)

TypeDefinition.Description: Association state for all load ports
Access mode for a load port. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E87.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Only manual (non-AMHS) carrier transfers are allowed (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Only automated (AMHS) carrier transfers are allowed (corresponds to SECS value 1)

TypeDefinition.Description: Defines the material status values supported by the equipment

EnumeratedString.Description: Processing Completed Successfully
Processing Failed

TypeDefinition.Description: List of material status values
Information about a location the substrate visited

Field.name: Location
Field.Description: The SubstLocID or BatchLocID.SubstPosInBatch for the location

Field.name: TimeIn
Field.Description: Time the substrate entered the location. This parameter is reported in the standard EDA time format, not the GEM selected format

Field.name: TimeOut
Field.Description: Time the substrate exited the location; empty until the substrate departs the location. This parameter is reported in the standard EDA time format, not the GEM selected format

TypeDefinition.Description: History of locations visited
List of Substrate Histories
Status of the substrate ID. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E90.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: The substrate identifier has not been confirmed (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Substrate ID could not be identified by the reader, was discovered to be at a wrong source location, or no matching ID in the source set (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Substrate ID has been confirmed by the equipment or the host after it was read (corresponds to SECS value 2)
Host decides to cancel the substrate (corresponds to SECS value 3)

TypeDefinition.Description: List of substrate ID status values
Processing state of the substrate. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E90.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Processing in the equipment is required and has not started (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Processing has started (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Processing has completed normally (corresponds to SECS value 2)
Processing has terminated abnormally (corresponds to SECS value 3)
Processing has terminated at completion of a certain processing step (corresponds to SECS value 4)
Substrate has been identified as needing special treatment (corresponds to SECS value 5)
Substrate has been removed from the equipment by an external agent or it is physically missing (corresponds to SECS value 6)
Substrate was not processed (corresponds to SECS value 7)

TypeDefinition.Description: List of substrate processing states
Transport state of the substrate. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E90.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Substrate is at the original location it was received (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Substrate has been taken from the original substrate location, and is traveling on intermediate equipment substrate locations (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Substrate has been placed at its designated destination substrate location (corresponds to SECS value 2)

TypeDefinition.Description: List of substrate transport states
Type of substrate. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E90.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Wafer (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Flat Panel (corresponds to SECS value 1)
CD (corresponds to SECS value 2)
Mask (corresponds to SECS value 3)

TypeDefinition.Description: List of substrate types
Defines how the substrate is used. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E90.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Substrate contains product being created by the facility (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Substrate used for testing processes (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Substrate used to fill open positions (corresponds to SECS value 2)

TypeDefinition.Description: List of substrate usage values
Array of values for a substrate group event; each string holds an identifier of a substrate or a location as appropriate
Carrier Source to Destination mapping

Field.name: SourceMap
Field.Description: Source carrier information

Field.name: DestinationMap
Field.Description: Describes carrier positions into which finished material is placed. Sequential order is followed when the list of substrate locations is empty

TypeDefinition.Description: Maps material from source to destination after processing
ProcessJob and its current state

Field.name: PRJobID
Field.Description: ProcessJob Identifier

Field.name: PRJobState
Field.Description: Current ProcessJob state

TypeDefinition.Description: List of all ProcessJobs managed by this ControlJob and their current states
Additional job control functionality

Field.name: RuleName
Field.Description: Identifier of a control rule

Field.name: RuleValue
Field.Description: The value used by the equipment for execution of a control rule

TypeDefinition.Description: List of additional job control functionality
Structure that defines the ProcessJob and rules for running it within this ControlJob

Field.name: PRJobID
Field.Description: ProcessJob Identifier

Field.name: ControlRule
Field.Description: Defines additional job control functionality

Field.name: OutputRule
Field.Description: Defines the material status based on the results of the ProcessJob

TypeDefinition.Description: List of structures that defines the ProcessJobs and rules for running each that will be run within this Control\Job
Defines the method for the order in which ProcessJobs are initiated. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E94.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: ProcessJobs shall be initiated as the material for the job arrives (corresponds to SECS value 1)
ProcessJobs shall be initialized in an order determined by internal equipment algorithms, that optimize the throughput of material in the equipment (corresponds to SECS value 2)
ProcessJobs shall be initiated in the order of the list in ProcessingCtrlSpec (corresponds to SECS value 3)

TypeDefinition.Description: ControlJob state. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in E94.1 but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: ControlJob is queued (corresponds to SECS value 0)
ControlJob does not initiate ProcessJobs specific in it, the processing resource is reserved to the ControlJob (corresponds to SECS value 1)
ControlJob is waiting to receive a Start command manually or remotely from the host (corresponds to SECS value 2)

Each ProcessJob in the ProcessingCtrlSpec is initiated in order, based on the value of the ControlJob's ProcessOrderMgmt attribute as resources become available and materials arrive (corresponds to SECS value 3)
ControlJob shall not commence the initiation of any more ProcessJobs (corresponds to SECS value 4)
All ProcessJobs have been completed, stopped, or aborted (corresponds to SECS value 5)

TypeDefinition.Description: Defines the material status values supported by the equipment

EnumeratedString.Description: The Material Status enumeration values are equipment specific and must be defined by the supplier

TypeDefinition.Description: Maps a material status to a destination carrier

Field.name: MaterialStatus
Field.Description: Processing status code assigned to material

Field.name: DestinationMap
Field.Description: Destination carrier information for the material status

TypeDefinition.Description: Maps locations or Carriers where processed material will be placed based on material status
Array of Process Jobs associated with the Control Job; each string holds a PRJobID
Array of Carriers associated with the Control Job; each string holds a CarrierID
Array of ControlJobs in the ControlJob queue; each string holds a CtrlJobID
Indentifies the most recent blocked condition of the related EPT module. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in EPT but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: EPT Module is not blocked (corresponds to SECS value 0)
The blocked reason is unknown (corresponds to SECS value 1)
A safety threshold value has been crossed (corresponds to SECS value 2)
An error condition has occurred within the EPT Module (corresponds to SECS value 3)
A parametric error was detected (corresponds to SECS value 4)
Process is Aborting or has Aborted (corresponds to SECS value 5)
Process is Pausing or has Paused (corresponds to SECS value 6)

TypeDefinition.Description: A list of zero to nine EPT State Model transitions for which event reporting to the host are disabled
Indicates whether this EPTTracker object refers to the equipment or an EPT module. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in EPT but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: EPT Tracker describes the equipment (corresponds to SECS value 0)
EPT Tracker describes a production module within the equipment (corresponds to SECS value 1)
EPT Tracker describes an EFEM or Load Port EPT within the equipment (corresponds to SECS value 2)

TypeDefinition.Description: The EPT state of this equipment or EPT module. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in EPT but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Equipment or Module is Idle (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Equipment or Module is Busy (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Equipment or Module is Blocked (corresponds to SECS value 2)

TypeDefinition.Description: The previous EPT state of this equipment or EPT module. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in EPT but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: Equipment or Module is Idle (corresponds to SECS value 0)
Equipment or Module is Busy (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Equipment or Module is Blocked (corresponds to SECS value 2)
No previous state exists for Equipment or Module (corresponds to SECS value 3)

TypeDefinition.Description: The type of task running on this EPT module. This is defined as a numeric enumeration in EPT but has been converted to strings for EDA

EnumeratedString.Description: EPT Module is Idle (or NoState for previous value)(corresponds to SECS value 0)
Type of task is not specified (corresponds to SECS value 1)
Normal or desired manufacturing operations that are capable of adding value by physical-chemical change or providing critical process information (corresponds to SECS value 2)
Normal or desired manufacturing operations that are incapable of adding value(corresponds to SECS value 3)
Any task that is intended to change the state of the equipment for the purpose of maintaining equipment functionality or performance (corresponds to SECS value 4)

5-Diagnostics">Any task that obtains information about the status of the equipment for the purpose of determining the equipment's health or identifying an equipment problem(corresponds to SECS value 5)
An equipment initiated task that indicates the module is encountering normal waiting periods as part of its normal wafer processing scenario (corresponds to SECS value 6)

TypeDefinition.Description: The most recent transition that updated the tracker

EnumeratedInteger.Description: Transition 1a, 1b, or 1c occurred (See E116:EPTStateModule and E116:EPTStateEquipment state machine definition)
Transition 2 occurred (See E116:EPTStateModule and E116:EPTStateEquipment state machine definition)
Transition 3 occurred (See E116:EPTStateModule and E116:EPTStateEquipment state machine definition)
Transition 4 occurred (See E116:EPTStateModule and E116:EPTStateEquipment state machine definition)
Transition 5 occurred (See E116:EPTStateModule and E116:EPTStateEquipment state machine definition)
Transition 6 occurred (See E116:EPTStateModule and E116:EPTStateEquipment state machine definition)
Transition 7 occurred (See E116:EPTStateModule and E116:EPTStateEquipment state machine definition)
Transition 8 occurred (See E116:EPTStateModule and E116:EPTStateEquipment state machine definition)
Transition 9 occurred (See E116:EPTStateModule and E116:EPTStateEquipment state machine definition)

TypeDefinition.Description: Array of time servers that are available to provide the current date and time information; each string holds an IP address
